historical_tradition.origins: Berlin's café culture began in 1721, with Germany's first coffee house appearing in Bremen in 1672
historical_tradition.golden_era: The Golden Twenties in Berlin - coffeehouse culture central to artistic and intellectual life
historical_tradition.famous_venues: Historic cafés like Romanisches Café were artists' living rooms, frequented by writers, artists, and actors

cultural_significance.kaffeeklatsch: 18th-century German tradition meaning 'coffee gossip' - informal gathering for conversation over coffee
cultural_significance.social_function: Cafés serve as sanctuaries from daily life, hubs of intellectual and social exchange
cultural_significance.pace: Culture prizes leisurely pace and quality, unlike grab-and-go culture elsewhere
